intro: Plagiobothrys catalinensis, commonly known as Catalina filaree, is a flowering plant native to the Channel Islands of California. It is a member of the Hydrophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in coastal habitats, often in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
